column4: I accidently changed a partition table on the wrong drive, and would like to try & recover the information on that drive prior to the format. Any ideas?
yeah, there are programs for that
any suggestions?
I think there are hard disk recovery live cds... let me check
so there's http://www.sysresccd.org/Main_Page
although, I can't remember the name of the best program for doing this kind of recovery
parted / gparted has some features to do it, but it's not the best
really looking for the best. From my experience, the more you dither with inferior products, the more likely you are not to retreive your information.\
I wrote the parted one, btw, hehe
I wrote the command-line one... not sure how good the graphical one is
but there are other ones that I think work very well
let me check
you wrote parted? :0 Thank you, my good man, I just learnt how to use it, and love parted.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TestDisk might be good?
thanks :)  I haven't touched it in 5 years though
if you like parted, you can use it's "rescue" command...
it's not too bad, but it's more designed for advanced users...
according to the wiki page, "TestDisk" is available on all the popular rescue CDs (such as parted magic, gparted live cd, system rescue cd, etc.)
so, I'd probably try that one out!
will do. Thank you kind sir.
no problem.  gotta go... bye! :)
bye
